skill.name: senior-fullstack
skill.description: Comprehensive fullstack development skill for building complete web applications with React, Next.js, Node.js, GraphQL, and PostgreSQL. Includes project scaffolding, code quality analysis, architecture patterns, and complete tech stack guidance. Use when building new projects, analyzing code quality, implementing design patterns, or setting up development workflows.
skill.summary: Comprehensive fullstack development skill for building complete web applications with React, Next.js...
skill.author: alirezarezvani

security_audit.summary: All 72 static findings are false positives. The scanner misinterprets TypeScript code blocks in markdown documentation as Ruby/shell backticks, flags benign documentation keywords like 'algorithm' and 'comprehensive' as weak cryptography, and misidentifies development workflow documentation as system reconnaissance. The actual Python scripts are benign scaffolding tools performing standard file operations with no dangerous operations.

content.value_statement: Building complete web applications requires coordinating multiple frameworks, databases, and DevOps tools. This skill provides automated scaffolding, code quality analysis, and architecture patterns so developers can focus on business logic instead of project setup.
actual_capabilities: Scaffold complete fullstack projects with React, Next.js, Node.js, GraphQL, and PostgreSQL
Analyze code quality and identify security, performance, and maintainability issues
Generate Docker Compose configurations and CI/CD pipelines
Apply architecture patterns for clean code, dependency injection, and domain-driven design
limitations: Does not execute code or deploy applications to live environments
Does not modify existing project files without explicit user request
Does not access external APIs or services during analysis

use_cases.title: New Project Setup
use_cases.description: Quickly scaffold production-ready fullstack projects with best practices built-in.

use_cases.title: Code Quality Review
use_cases.description: Analyze existing codebases and get actionable recommendations for improvement.

use_cases.title: Architecture Decisions
use_cases.description: Apply proven patterns for scalable, maintainable application architecture.

prompt_templates.title: Create Project
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the senior-fullstack skill to scaffold a new Next.js project with GraphQL and PostgreSQL at ./my-new-app.

prompt_templates.title: Analyze Code
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the code quality analyzer on my project at ./src and show me the findings.

prompt_templates.title: Add Features
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me the repository pattern implementation from the architecture patterns reference for my Node.js API.

prompt_templates.title: Optimize
prompt_templates.prompt: What performance optimizations should I consider for my React frontend based on the tech stack guide?

output_examples.input: Scaffold a new Next.js project with GraphQL and PostgreSQL
output: Added Docker Compose with PostgreSQL and Redis
Added Jest and React Testing Library setup

output_examples.input: Analyze code quality of my React application
output: Performance: Consider code splitting for large components

output_examples.input: What architecture patterns should I use for my Node.js API?

best_practices: Always review generated code before committing to ensure it matches your requirements
Use the verbose flag when debugging to understand exactly what the scaffolder creates
Combine with other skills like senior-devops for complete production deployments
anti_patterns: Do not run the scaffolder on production systems without reviewing the output first
Avoid modifying the same project multiple times without backing up changes
Do not rely solely on automated analysis for security-critical code reviews

faq.question: What tech stacks are supported?
faq.answer: Next.js, React, Node.js, Express, GraphQL, REST, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, MySQL, and Docker.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my existing files?
faq.answer: No, the scaffolder creates new projects. The analyzer is read-only by default.

faq.question: Can I customize the generated templates?
faq.answer: Yes, review the scripts directory and modify templates before running scaffolder commands.

faq.question: Does this work with monorepos?
faq.answer: Point the analyzer at specific directories within your monorepo for targeted analysis.

faq.question: What CI/CD platforms are supported?
faq.answer: GitHub Actions and CircleCI templates are generated. GitLab and others can be configured manually.

faq.question: Is network access required?
faq.answer: No network access is used. All operations are local file system operations.
